verses.verse: Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God, and Timothy, our brother, to the church of God which is at Corinth together with God's people who are in Achaia.
May grace and peace be yours from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
Blessed be God, even the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of mercies and God of all comfort,
who comforts us in all our troubles, so that we may be able to comfort those who are in any trouble by the comfort which we ourselves are comforted by God.
Just as the sufferings of Christ are plentiful in us, so our comfort also is plentiful through Christ.
If we are afflicted, it is for your comfort and salvation, which is effective for enduring the same sufferings which we also suffer, or if we are comforted, it is also for your comfort and salvation.
Our hope for you is steadfast, knowing that just as you are partakers of the sufferings, so also you will be of the comforting.
Brethren, we don't want you to be ignorant of our trouble that happened to us in Asia, for we were under pressure beyond endurance, so much so that we even thought we might die.
We had the death sentence on us, so that we shouldn't trust in ourselves but in God who raises the dead,
who delivered us from such a great death and still delivers; in whom we trust will continue to deliver [us].
Also you are helping us by praying for us, so that the gift for us from many people [will cause] many people to give thanks on our behalf.
For our rejoicing is this (the witness of our conscience), because with openness and godly sincerity, not human wisdom, but by the grace of God, we've lived in this world and especially towards you.
We are not writing anything else to you than what you read and understand, and I trust you will understand even to the end,
just as you have partly understood us, because we are your reason to rejoice even as you are ours on the Day of the Lord Jesus.
I am so confident about this that I made plans to come to you previously, so that you might have another blessing,
and to visit you on my way to Macedonia, then to return from Macedonia to you, and from you to be assisted on my journey towards Judea.
Therefore when I had made up my mind, was I fickle, or in the things did I plan with selfish motives, or that yes may be yes and no may be no?
God is faithful, for our preaching to you was not "yes" and "no."
For the Son of God, Jesus Christ, who was preached to you by us--Silas, Timothy, and me--was not "yes" and "no" but in him was "yes."
For all God's promises are "yes" and in him, the Amen, for the glory of God through us.
Now he who establishes us and you in Christ and who has anointed us is God,
who authenticates us as genuine and given us the Holy Spirit as a pledge in our hearts.
And I call on God as a witness on my soul, that I didn't come to Corinth, so I could spare you.
We are not trying to lord it over your faith, but we are co-workers for your joy, for by faith you stand.
